titlestmt.titleproper: Union Congregational Church (Lenox and Sullivan, N.Y.) Records
titlestmt.subtitle: An inventory of the records at Syracuse University
titlestmt.author: LDC

did.head: Overview of the Collection

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Union Congregational Church (Lenox and Sullivan, N.Y.)

did.unittitle: Union Congregational Church (Lenox and Sullivan, N.Y.) Records
did.abstract: Minutes and membership records of a church in Madison County.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: The Union Congregational Church of Lenox and Sullivan, N.Y. was an American Congregational Church during the 19th century. Congregational churches are Protestant churches that practice self-governance, asserting the authority of the local congregation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p:
The
Union Congregational Church (Lenox and Sullivan, N.Y.) Records contains a single bound volume of meeting minutes and membership records from the church, dating from 1814-1837.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The majority of our archival and manuscript collections are housed offsite and require advanced notice for retrieval. Researchers are encouraged to contact us in advance concerning the collection material they wish to access for their research.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Written permission must be obtained from SCRC and all relevant rights holders before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from any materials in this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

Union Congregational Church (Lenox and Sullivan, N.Y.) Records
